;;C;;harles Darwin; liked an蚯蚓。 What earthworms felt about Charles Darwin is less clear. For 40 years he studied them, thought about them and experimented on them. He exhaled on them to see if they disliked his breath (they didn't) and held a poker to them to see if they minded the heat (they generally did). He wafted perfume and then paraffin in front of them, and he played them a whistle, a bassoon and the piano. They seemed nonplussed. He fed them mint (which they didn't care for), cabbage (which they did) and other worms, halved (catholic in their tastes, they enjoyed their diet of worms).

;

;Darwin recorded all this somewhat apologetically. To many people, he wrote, the subject of worms may “appear an insignificant one”. The modern world has tended to agree. Unlike “On the Origin of Species”, his book “The Formation of Vegetable Mould, Through the Action of Worms” is no longer a noted bestseller.

;;T;;HEY LOOKED; humble enough.一位观察者将丁香植物与月桂灌木进行了比较，而他注意到肉豆蔻生长在类似梨树的东西上。尽管它们的外观很常见，但在 16 世纪，这些香料很特别，不仅仅是因为，由于进化的偶然，它们只生长在马来群岛的少数岛屿上，这些岛屿后来被称为香料群岛。 As Roger Crowley, a British maritime historian, explains in an engaging new look at seasoning's long ago seasons, nutmeg and cloves would have effects far beyond the kitchen, kindling revolutions from mapmaking to spycraft.

;;T;;三十年前;，当现在进入 40 多岁的女性开始生育时，东亚各国政府有理由庆祝。如果一名韩国女性的行为方式与其年长同胞相同，那么她在育龄期后平均会生育 1.7 个孩子，而 1970 年为 4.5 个。 ;整个地区;，政策制定者大幅降低了青少年怀孕率。 The drop in birth rates, which occured over the span of a single generation, was a stunning success. That was until it carried on.

;如果韩国女性效仿这一榜样，那么她在育龄期间平均只会生 0.7 个孩子她的年长同龄人。自 2006 年以来，该国政府每年花费 2700 亿美元（略高于 GDP 的 1%）用于育儿激励措施，例如父母税收减免、产妇护理，甚至国家资助的约会。 Officials would love even just a few of the “missing” births back.
